Amazon's Big Spring Sale event runs until March 31, and hundreds of excellent PC gaming accessories are part of the savings. From controllers and keyboards to monitors and memory cards, a little bit of everything is seeing a discount throughout the rest of the month. Navigating the thousands of deals is time-consuming--so we've compiled the best PC gaming deals at Amazon below.

  • Logitech
  • Razer

Keep in mind that availability and pricing are subject to change, and the most popular products could sell out before the sale ends. For more great deals, check out all the 4K Blu-rays available for $13 or less. This includes hit films like The Lion King, American Psycho, Parasite, and The Thing. Alternatively, there's a massive B2G1 free sale featuring not just 4K Blu-rays, but also box sets, books, and more.

Gaming monitors

Whether you're looking for an affordable or ultra-luxurious monitor, Amazon has you covered. The popular 24-Inch Samsung Odyssey G3 Series Monitor is a frugal option at $120 (was $200). Featuring a 180Hz refresh rate, 1ms response time, and AMD FreeSync for tear-free gaming, it's a wonderful choice at this new price point.

On the other hand, the 49-Inch Samsung Odyssey QD-OLED Curved Monitor is seeing a big price cut to $950 (was $1,600). Aside from its massive size, it gets you a 240Hz refresh rate, 0.03ms response time, and a three-year warranty for added peace of mind. You should also consider the 49-Inch INNOCN OLED Ultrawide Curved Monitor, as it's $150 cheaper than the Samsung model yet still packs in features that make it great for gaming.

Storage

The Samsung Pro Plus 1TB is a great choice for Steam Deck, thanks to its reliable and fast performance. At just $80 (was $120), this is the lowest price we've ever seen for the microSD card. If you're looking to expand your desktop storage, the Samsung 990 Pro 4TB SSD is $280 (was $465) and the Acer Predator 2TB SSD is $113 (was $133). The latter might be the better option, as it can hit similar speeds as the more expensive 990 Pro (but if you truly need 4GB, the Samsung model is an easy recommendation). Samsung is also discounting its Samsung T7 Shield 2TB Portable SSD to $150 (was $285), which gets you excellent drop, dust, and water resistance--making it a great spot to store important files.

CPUs

Building or upgrading your rig? A bunch of AMD and Intel processors are seeing excellent price cuts through March 31. The AMD Ryzen 9 9950X (16-Core, 24-Thread) is a premium choice for gaming, and it's down to its lowest price ever at $532.56 (was $649). More affordable options include the AMD Ryzen 5 9600X (6-Core, 12-Thread) for $223 (was $279) or Intel Core i7-12700KF (8P + 4E) for $155 (was $183).

Keyboards

Logitech, Razer, and Corsair keyboards are all part of Amazon's Big Spring Sale. The Razer Huntsman Mini 60% Keyboard is an excellent choice for gaming, thanks to linear optical switches that actuate faster than most of the competition and a small footprint that leaves plenty of space for sweeping mouse movements. You can also check out the Razer BlackWidow V3 Mechanical Keyboard, as the pink edition is just $100 (was $140). The Logitech G413 Full-Size doesn't look nearly as flashy as Razer's offerings--but with tactile switches, 6-key rollover, and a series of media keys, it's a solid entry-level choice at $49 (was $80).

Cases and Towers

A handful of PC cases and towers are on sale, largely of the mid-tower variety. Many of these come with built-in RGB lights--including the popular NZXT H5 Flow RGB Compact ATX Mid-Tower, which is on sale for $90 (was $120). A premium alternative is the Corsair 6500D Airflow Mid-Tower ATX Dual Chamber, as its tempered glass and mesh siding make it easy to keep all your components cool during the heat of battle.

Mice

Though it looks a bit funky, the Asus ROG Spatha X Wireless Gaming Mouse is an ideal companion for MMO gaming. It'll take you a few minutes to acclimate to its chunky design, but with 12 programmable buttons and a responsive sensor, it's great for games like Guild Wars 2, World of Warcraft, and Elder Scrolls Online. You'll find it on sale for $110 (was $150). Traditional gaming mouse options include the ultra-responsive Razer Basilisk V3 Pro Gaming Mouse for $118 (was $160), the simple Logitech G Pro Wireless Gaming Mouse for $69 (was $130), and the Razer Viper V2 Pro Wireless Gaming Mouse for $85 (was $150).

Headsets

Now is the time to upgrade your headset, with several fantastic options on sale at the best prices of the year. The Sony Inzone H9 Wireless Headset is back down to its lowest price ever at $198. the head features a flip-to-mute microphone and plush earcups designed to stay comfortable during long play sessions. The Razer Kaira is also down to its lowest price ever, matching the discount that appeared around Black Friday. This version was designed specifically for Xbox, but it should work without issue on PC thanks to its 2.4Ghz USB dongle.

Though it's not exactly a gaming headset, the extremely popular Bose QuietComfort Wireless Headphones are now $249 (was $349). They're great not just for listening to music and traveling, but they work for gaming too--but they're better for single-player gaming, as they don't have a fancy microphone like dedicated headsets.

Controllers

While a good keyboard and mouse setup will work for most games, some are just better with a gamepad. The PDP Victrix Pro BFG Wireless Controller is a great choice for PC, thanks to remappable buttons, customizable triggers, and a modular design that lets you swap around its components. It also works on Xbox, giving it added versatility. Its current price of $108 (was $180) is the best we've ever seen. Affordable alternatives include the CRKD Neo S, the Luna Wireless Controller, and GuliKit KK3. All three are listed under $50.

Mini PCs

A mini PC might not be as powerful as a full-size desktop or gaming laptop, but it's a good compromise if you're working with limited desk space. They're also fairly portable, and attempting to lug one over to a friend's house isn't nearly as daunting as a tower. If you want to do some light gaming on your mini PC, check out the Minisforum UM890 Pro Mini. Equipped with a Ryzen 9 8945HS, 64GB RAM, and 1TB SSD, it's surprisingly well equipped. It's currently on sale for $728 (was $910), making it a good time to add it to your game room. You'll find more affordable options like the AceMagician K1 Mini and the Beelink EQ 12 Mini, and while both are excellent for daily tasks and low-end gaming, don't expect to run the latest releases on high settings.

8BitDo makes some of our favorite PC accessories, many of which are on sale at Amazon. This includes a long list of keyboards like the NES-inspired full-size Retro Mechanical Keyboard (N Edition), as you can snag it for $96 (was $120). Along with great mechanical switches and versatile connectivity settings--Bluetooth, 2.4GHz Wireless, and wired--each 8BitDo keyboard comes with a detachable module with two large buttons. Dubbed Dual Super Buttons, this gaming-focused bonus utilizes microswitches to promote precision and speed. If you opt for the Commodore 64-inspired model, you'll also get a detachable arcade stick. item.title: Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 3 Will Be Star Wars-Themed According To Leaker
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fortnite-chapter-6-season-3-will-be-star-wars-themed-according-to-leaker/1100-6530405/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 3 is expected to arrive in May and a prominent leaker has revealed that it will be a mini-season focused on Star Wars, which has had multiple events and skins in the battle royale in the past.

According to Loolo on X, Season 3 will be a mini-season, running only 30 days, and will be themed around Star Wars. This means bosses, NPCs, points of interest, and items will be added to the game from Star Wars and the battle pass will be Star Wars-themed. Loolo said that the battle pass will feature four to five skins, although it's unclear if all of them will be Star Wars skins or if only some of them.

BREAKING: SEASON 3 IS STAR WARS THEMED! ðŸ‘€ðŸ”¥

With the help of @X0X_LEAK, I can confirm that season 3 is Star Wars themed, with it lasting aprox. 30 days!

We will get new Star Wars bosses, NPCs, POIs, items, and more! (stay tuned for more info)

The Battle Pass should includeâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/HlopCWQgdp

â€” Loolo | Fortnite Leaks (@Loolo_WRLD) March 26, 2025

This lines up with how Fortnite and Star Wars have crossed over in the past, starting around May 4, sometimes used as a day to celebrate Star Wars--May the Fourth be with you. This is the same time of year Fortnite has had Star Wars events in the past. Fortnite also has tons of Star Wars cosmetics already, including Anakin, Luke, Leia, Darth Vader, Storm Troopers, and more, making it difficult to predict which characters might be getting skins in the upcoming season, especially with the possibility that there could be different outfits for characters that have already appeared.

Disney and Fortnite have collaborated for themed seasons in the past, including multiple Marvel seasons. Disney also invested $1.5 billion into Epic Games in 2024, with plans to build a persistent Disney universe with the Fortnite developer. Season 3 of Fortnite OG just kicked off as well, bringing back the old map and adding a battle pass featuring remixed versions of old skins.

item.title: Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet Reveals So Far Are Just The "Tip Of The Iceberg," Director Says
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/intergalactic-the-heretic-prophet-reveals-so-far-are-just-the-tip-of-the-iceberg-director-says/1100-6530396/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet is a new IP from Uncharted and The Last of Us developer Naughty Dog, and while it won't release until 2027 at the soonest, the game is in a playable state already and feeling "really good," according to director Neil Druckmann.

He told IGN, "We are playing it at the office and it's incredible. It's really good."

He added: "I'm so excited to finally put gameplay out into the world and show people about it, because we just showed you the very, very, very tip on the iceberg. The game goes pretty deep beyond that."

Druckmann is referring to the game's announcement trailer at The Game Awards in December 2024. The trailer (above) shows off some of the game's characters and cuts off just as things get brewing with an intense fight.

Intergalactic is a game "about faith and religion" that takes place around 2,000 years in the future in a universe that diverged from our own in the 1980s.

Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet is in development for PS5 but does not have a release window at this time. Druckmann previously admitted that Naughty Dog "still have a ways to go" in developing the game and he doesn't have a clear idea of the final form Intergalactic will take just yet.

The game features a number of celebrities in starring roles, including Tati Gabrielle as the main character Jordan, along with Kumail Nanjiani, Ashley Scott, and Tony Dalton.

Naughty Dog has at least one other single-player game in development right now, and while some expected it to be The Last of Us 3, that may not be the case.

item.title: Drug-Selling Game Explodes On Steam Charts, Surpassing Assassin's Creed Shadows
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/drug-selling-game-explodes-on-steam-charts-surpassing-assassins-creed-shadows/1100-6530401/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The DEA has Schedule 1 drugs, substances, or chemicals defined as "drugs with no currently accepted medical use and a high potential for abuse." It shares the name with a new game that's blowing up the charts on Steam and players can dive into early access now.

In Schedule 1, you take the role of a small-time drug dealer rolling into a new city with no cash, no product, and no hookups or clients. The game's objective is to build your drug empire from the ground up as you contend against law enforcement and rival deadly cartel members so you can expand your empire and become a drug kingpin.

Released just yesterday, Schedule 1 quickly climbed to the top of the charts of not only Trending Games, but also Popular Releases, and Hot Releases on SteamDB. The game even reached 116,408 concurrent first-day players--almost double that of Assassin's Creed: Shadows. It reached a new high today with over 131,000.

Some players might remember playing Drug Wars on their TI-86 in high school, and at its foundation, Schedule 1 seems similar in that aspect. However, Schedule 1 also has multiplayer capabilities that help you take your empire to greater heights. The game even breaks down your drug-making process to include monitoring lighting, growth, and even when to harvest your plants for the best product possible.

Schedule 1 is currently on sale and players who buy now will have early access until March 31, when the price will go back up by 25-50% afterwards.
